name: Park Inn by Radisson Fresno

reviews.title: Quite Location
reviews.text: A very nice quiet hotel, quite large rooms with all facilities one would require. Although we didn't use it the pool looked very inviting.
Found the restaurant to bo very good,with a good food and wine menu at good prices.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay

reviews.text: Free use of the internet in the lobby, although only one terminal.
reviews.title: Nice quiet stay

likes.liked: — Comfortable and quiet night on our way to Yosemite
likes.disliked: — No continental breakfast and pool wasn't heated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was forced to stay in Fresno for business, and had stayed in a Holiday Inn Express previously that I was not happy with. I was very pleasantly surprised with the Sheraton. The staff were efficient and friendly and accomodated my room request without question. The room was clean and well appointed with a leather recliner and a small sofa, which provided a nice place to read that was not the bed. When I called the front desk with questions, the staff greeted me by name. When I tried to turn the heat on, and it did not work, I called the front desk and they sent out a tech in two minutes who fixed the problem. All in all, a very nice stay.
reviews.title: Good, but not great.

likes.liked: — The service was nice, bed was comfy, more than average furniture.
likes.disliked: — The free breakfast, the lack of water pressure, the broken chair.

reviews.text: The hotel does look at little older from the outside, but the rooms are nice in the inside. The beds were comfortable and the room was large enough for my family of 4. The pool area is very nice, but the pool was not heated and the water was rather cold in early April. There's a shopping center across the street and a decent Country Waffle breakfast restaurant about a block away. The hotel is arranged with many different buildings around the pool with trees and flowers. The buildings are named after tropical islands. Overall, the hotel is nicely kept.
reviews.title: Great stay, No problems
Better than expected.....
reviews.text: A three night stay recently was surprise. The property is clean, staying in the preferred Starwood members area was quiet, and the front desk pleasant. Beds were not "heavenly" but certainly a higher quality than than the usual business/interstate motel variety. It was clean, minutes from resturants, shopping, etc. I would stay again, if business brought me back to Fresno.

My idea of ‘Above Average’ may be much different from most willing to settle for an inexpensive room… However, as a business traveler, I look for cleanliness, bed comfort, fast internet, and conveniences like a refrigerator and microwave. A view is always the cherry on top of my rapid rewards.
reviews.title: surprised at the quality.

likes.liked: — surprised by the quality of rooms and restaurant / bar

reviews.text: Okay – Four Points by Sheraton Fresno
reviews.title: upper class remodel needs customer service upgrade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would have never expected this part of the neighborhood to host such a nice, upgraded hotel. Generally, the Four Points franchise is not that inviting –however, this hotel is upgraded with the newer vibe. Here is a quickie review:
reviews.title: Perfect for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Ditto; Best in Fresno

likes.liked: — Spacious and clean rooms; great beds.
likes.disliked: — Book through the Starwood webpage for deals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here last year and I was a little concerned about there being a noise problem. Last time we stayed, we changed rooms because the folks in the next room were noisy. However, this was not a problem for us at this time.
reviews.title: Not Bad

reviews.text: The room was quiet, clean. The free WiFi is very nice. Air conditioning worked fine.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.text: The bed was comfortable, though the sheets were thin and not the quality I would expect for a hotel in this price range. And, I don't understand why every hotel (it seems) now provides a down comforter instead of a blanket on the bed. It's 100 + degrees in Fresno in the summer time, we don't need a down comforter. At the very least, provide a thin blanket and the down comforter
reviews.title: Spacious, Free Wi-Fi, Comfortable!

likes.liked: — The employee named Art- he was so friendly and helpful!

reviews.text: The bathroom was okay, good shower. Nice big closet. Room service was prompt and the food was okay. Not great, but not bad.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Fresno

likes.liked: — The friendly staff and comfortable beds

reviews.text: We didn't use the pool, but it looked like it would be fun. Many of the rooms open onto the courtyard where the pool is located.
reviews.title: So So

likes.disliked: — Noise level and lack of response from management to quiet guests

reviews.text: Recently stayed at the Four Points Fresno while in town to see Madonna. From the previous reviews I read I wasn't quite sure what to expect but was happy to have no problems whatsoever. Property and grounds are very nice and room was spotless. Rooms were larger than average and the beds were very comfortable. I noticed other people mentioned that this hotel had no air conditioning but our room DID have air conditioning and it worked very well. From what I could see, this looked to be the nicest hotel in the area. I would not hesitate to stay again.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Fresno

reviews.text: We left the Monterey peninsula(see Lighthouse Lodge,Pacific Grove)for a day in Yosemite(not enough time)and coming off the scenic high of Glacier Point and Yosemite Valley and driving the switchback roads we were beat and needed a comfortable bed.The four points did not let us down.The beds were the highlight of this stay which for a traveler is very important.The room was nice enough and the tree womenhad no issues with the bath.Second floor facing pool was good.Climbing one set of stairs no big deal.Was quiet enough.The biggest gripe I had was with the reservation process.It was a wednesday night and not very busy.First two clerks would not accept entertainment card.I called a couple weeks ago to get the rack rate($170) and she said no problem getting half off($85).Finally after15 minutes on the phone with Chris(supervor)he came back and said $92.I said ok.All this hastle to bump me 7 bucks.With no breakfast(just room cofeemaker)it wasn't the best value.For those who pay $125 or more I would look around.Picadilly would not accept ent. card either.All in all,for one night in a comfortable it was ok.As some others mentioned the ac unit was older and did not function well.Parking was fine,fairly easy on off Rt.41.When reserving ask for the supervisor or manager to get your best deal.The ground and flowers pleasing.Would stay again if ever in Fresno.
reviews.title: good beds,staff not very helpful reserving room

reviews.text: The room we were given was on the ground floor of the main building that houses reception. While the room was large and clean the bathroom was a bit shabby (but clean). We found you could hear every footstep from the room above us so it made sleeping a bit difficult. The staff here were very friendly and the free internet access was handy for doing some travel research. The location is close to shopping there are lots of places to eat. All in all I would say the hotel is OK to stay at but would expect more for the money, it was one of the dearer places we stayed at while on holiday.
reviews.title: OK but expected better for the money
Oldtime charm, maybe not for everybody
reviews.text: The hotel consists of several two-story buildings (with no elevators) which show their age. The outside looks worn and inside rooms and hallways have a bad odor you have to fight against by opening the window and turning on the fan at the same time. That said there is nothing negative to report further. The structures surround an attractively landscaped pool area. Rooms are much larger than in modern hotels.

aka: Four Points By Sheraton Fresno Hotel
